page.title: 04SMEATHARPE - FARMS
page.content: The area surrounding Smeatharpe has 1O farms, namely: Burrow's, The Knowle, Gotleigh, Chapelhayes, Riggle's, Gorwell, Bywood, Gullylane, Mathayes, and Fair Oak. Bywood and Gorwell are reputed to have been mentioned in the first Domesday Book when they were entered as Biude and Gorwelle. Buide Farm is believed to have been part of the Dunkeswell Abbey estate where the monks had the farm producing corn. As will be seen from the landcover categories on the grid map, most of the farmland is used for silage, hay or grazing for dairy cattle. There is some arable farming, some enclosed rough grazing, (particularly around Gotleigh and Hense Moors) and a small area of woodland at Fair Oak Farm where the land drops down.
